page.title: 19LITTLE MILL SAWMILL
page.content: The blacksmith's shop of 150years ago developed into a carriage shop where many local wheelwrights learned their trade and now it is the sawmill. The present owner who had had a fire block round developed many contacts for his present business.Having abandoned the haulage side the cutting of the wood took over.Logs are sawn with a 5ins.band saw into the right sizes according to order.Both local soft and old hardwoods are used. First quality oak may be used as fence posts,planking and beams whilst second quality for industrial packaging, chocks and coverboards.Other than notching,the wood is left in plain lengths.The sawdust is used to make flakeboards and any waste for the owner's fuel.The owner is proud to be a selfmade businessman having started with minimal capital.
